Greatest Chalukya

The most valiant king of the Chalukya dynasty. The 'Aihole Inscription', composed by his court poet Ravikirti, provides a detailed account of his victories.

тЪФя╕П
Defeated Harshavardhana

He defeated the emperor of North India, Harshavardhana, on the banks of the Narmada River, which is considered his greatest achievement. He then assumed the title 'Dakshinapotheshvara'.

ЁЯМП
Diplomacy

He sent an envoy to Khosrow II, the king of Persia. This is depicted in a painting at Ajanta (disputed).

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • Titles: Satyashraya, Vallabha, Maharaj, Parmeshwar, Dakshinapotheshvara.
  • Pallava Conflict: Invaded Kanchi (defeated Mahendravarman), but was later killed by Narasimhavarman I.
  • Xuanzang: The Chinese traveler visited his kingdom in 641 AD and praised the loyalty of his subjects.
